column1: Las Piedras is a city in the Canelones Department of Uruguay. As of the census of 2011
column2: it is the fifth most populated city of the country.

column1: Las Piedras is also the name of the municipality to which the city belongs.
The city is located on the east side of Route 5
column2: 2.5 kilometres (1.6 mi) north of the border with Montevideo Department. Bordering La Paz to the south and Montevideo to the southeast
column3: it belongs to the wider metropolitan area of Montevideo. The stream Arroyo de las Piedras flows by the city.

column1: Las Piedras was founded in 1744 under the name "San Isidro".On May 18
column2: 1811 the Uruguayan independence leader don José Gervasio Artigas led patriot forces to victory against Spain at the Battle of Las Piedras. While not the definitive event in the country's independence process
column3: it marked a significant step towards the eventual establishment of an independent Uruguay.

column1: It had acquired the status of "Pueblo" (village) before the Independence of Uruguay. Its status was elevated to "Ciudad" (city) on 15 May 1925 by the Act of Ley Nº 7.837.
